tip.para: TYPO3 Phoenix is built on top of the FLOW3 framework. If you run into technical problems, feel free to check the FLOW3 documentation for possible hints as well.

section.title: Requirements
section.para: The following minimum requirements are operating system independent. Developers report working setups on Debian Linux, MacOS, Windows XP and Windows Vista and Windows 7.

listitem.para:
PHP 5.3.0 or newer (but not PHP 6)
Modules: mbstring, pdo_sqlite
Configuration: magic_quotes_gpc = off

Apache
Apache modules: mod_rewrite
Apache configuration: AllowOverride FileInfo
IIS7 on Windows 7 with URL Rewrite has succesfully been tested as well.
Cherokee under Mac OS 10.6 (Snow Leopard) is working fine.

section.para:
Other webservers could work, but have not been tested until now.
XAMPP 1.7.2a on MacOS does not work, it complains about syntax errors in the source files, probably caused by a bug in the implementation of the zend string optimizer.

section.title: Installation of TYPO3 Phoenix

step.para: Download the TYPO3 Phoenix Sprint Release distribution from http://flow3.typo3.org/typo3-phoenix/download/

Unpack it to the document root of the webserver (often "htdocs")
It is highly recommended to change the document root of the webserver to the Web subfolder of the distribution!

The webserver needs write permissions for some subfolders. The distribution provides a helper script for Unix like operating systems, which sets the permissions. Change to the top level folder of the distribution, from there call the script Packages/Framework/FLOW3/Scripts/setfilepermissions.sh. Execute this script providing the CLI user, webserver user and webserver group as parameters. On Debian Linux (Lenny) the commando would look like this:

Now, just go to http://<hostname>/ and wait (this may take some time on the first call, because FLOW3 needs to initialize itself and to create caching data). You will get a notice that TYPO3 has not been initialized yet. Follow the instructions to import some demo content, and set your desired Backend Username and Password.

section.para: Now you can check if everything works by pointing your browser to http://<hostname>/ . If all is well you should see the start page of the TYPO3 Phoenix demo site : The TYPO3 Phoenix start page
